Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the similarity between the language used in the National Security Council memos of different presidents.
Understate: The claim may be understating the differences in the makeup of the full National Security Council between different presidents.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to prove that the language used in the memos is "identical" to the language used by previous presidents.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the language used in the memos is the only factor to consider when evaluating the restructuring of the National Security Council.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the differences in the makeup of the National Security Council between different presidents, such as the inclusion of a chief strategist in Trump's council.
